passage.text: High affinity binding of proteins HMG1 and HMG2 to semicatenated DNA loops

Our research has revealed that Form X, which is a DNA loop with semicatenated DNA junction at its base, has the highest affinity among all known DNA structures. This implies that if these structures are present in the cell nucleus, one of their functions may be related to the unique yet reversible property of DNA chaperones, specifically for linking two remote regions of the genome.

During replication, Hepadnaviruses use reverse transcription of pregenomic RNA molecules. The viral viruses initiate replication by interacting with the viral reverse transcriptase (P) and using a primer to bind to the 5' copy of before starting DNA synthesis.
